website_summaries.verdict: Big advantage of this liner is that it is shaped to fit inside your mummy sleeping bag.
pros: Can help reduce the number of times you need to wash your sleeping bag if you are on a long expedition
Polyester fabric helps keep you warmer all night
Insert can be used by itself on top of your sleeping bag on warm nights
Packs down inside its own sack to 3.5 by 6.5 inches
cons: The bag does not have a zipper, which can make entry a little difficult

customer_reviews.title: keeps you toasty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after freezing in the mountains overnight in my ultralight sleeping bag rated for 42 degrees F, when it was probably in the mid to upper 30s overnight. Since I bought this liner, I've used it a couple times when it got down to 30s overnight, and it has kept me very toasty with wearing only leggings and a t shirt. I'm surprised at how much warmer my bag is with this liner, since it's pretty thin. I tried using it when I slept on my friend's couch, and I woke up sweating because I wore a sweatshirt in my liner (I was okay once I peeled off the sweatshirt). Great buy, and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Well made liner
customer_reviews.text: Just received. Manufacturing looks good. No bad chemical smells, that have been reported on with other liner bags. I bought this as a sleeping system. Even if there is no increase in warmth, it should at least keep the inside of the sleeping bag cleaner. And easier to wash this bag, instead of the whole sleeping bag. Will be using this in a Kelty Tuck 22 (regular length) bag. Also have a SOL Escape Bivvy for an outer shell. All three items fit together well. If there is a negative to this system, I will update in the future.
customer_reviews.author: W.E.A.

customer_reviews.title: If I could go back I wouldn't buy this
customer_reviews.text: MUCH too confining, a mummy bag is bad enough, no extra difficulty is needed. And the opening on the side is MUCH too short, making this very hard to slide into. It is lightweight, and does add a little warmth, and of course it helps a little in keeping your bag clean (NOT a lot, it slides all over the place and won't keep all parts of the inside of your bag covered). Al things considered, if I could start over I would just buy a bag that's rated for a lower temperature, and that's easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Why have a bag with no liner?
customer_reviews.text: Simple sleeping bag liner. Used with a sleeping bag so it doesn't get dirty. Have also used with a bivy sack when I didn't wanna carry a sleeping bag. On hotter nights can just use the liner as a sleeping bag itself. I think a sleeping bag liner is a must have item.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: This bag liner is nice!
customer_reviews.text: This bag liner is nice! I like the fact it will extend the life of my bag; it is an extra layer of insulation; and protects my bag so it doesn't need to be cleaned as often. It would be great if there was a way to attach the liner to the inside of the bag (like buttons or something) but make it removable so it can be washed easily. That way it wouldn't move as I move in the bag during the night.
customer_reviews.author: RickW

customer_reviews.title: cheap and easy, it still doesn't get rid of the clammy ...
customer_reviews.text: cheap and easy , it still doesn't get rid of the clammy feeling I get from using a sleeping bag but I was not cold . the lack of a zipper didn't make a difference to me it is easy to slip in and out of. it was much cheaper than my daughters $50 rei liner and just as functional. The liner kept drafts to a minimum when my zipper slipped open during the night on my old bag. for temperate spring and fall weather this liner passed.
customer_reviews.author: martin dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great little liner
customer_reviews.text: I took this liner on a backpacking trip in Minnesota. My sleeping bag is rated to 35 degrees, and I was concerned that I would be cold. The liner worked perfectly, adding those few degrees I needed to be comfy on some very cold nights. It was great to be able to wear long johns and a light fleece and not have to bundle up more than that. The liner packed very small and was very light to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Snowflake

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be a good liner
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but I'm certain It'll do what it's intended to do. Sleeping bag liners act as "sheets" in a sleeping bag, and depending on construction material may add a few degrees-worth of insulation (warmth) to the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Literally all “stuffable” mummy bags make me sweat at night, whether it’s -20 or 50 degrees at night. It’s just the materials they’re made from, plain and simple. This has eliminated that problem without adding much weight and even adding a few degrees of warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Atbylund

customer_reviews.title: Fine quality Sleep System Item
customer_reviews.text: This liner is gi-normous! You can even use it as a sleeping sheet instead of a sleeping bag in the summer. It slept with a cheap 20 degree bag in about < 30 degree weather with this liner and a blanker over me and I stayed fairly warm. I don't know how I would have faired without this liner. You can wrap it around your face with the sewn-in strings under the flap. If you need a line, I think this is a fine quality item to add to your sleep system.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Onion

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, good value, but not like the Sea To Summit wool sleeping bag liners
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a Sea To Summit wool sleeping bag liner but I really didn't want to spend that kind of money. I got this and it does the job of keeping me a little warmer just fine. However it is much heavier and packs larger, so you get what you pay for. But I'm not an ultra-light backpacker so this works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: This is great for adding 10 degrees of comfort to your sleep ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great for adding 10 degrees of comfort to your sleep system, but my favorite use is a replacement for my 55-bag during the summer. I take the 55-bag to be on the safe side, but more often than not I just end up sleeping in this liner--it's perfect for warm summer nights.It also washes up great!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great liner. Washes well & kept me warm.
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag liner! Washed it before and after using, and washes up nicely. Washed it in cold water in the washer, as opposed to the instructions that said to hand wash warm. Also tossed it around in the dryer for a little bit and hung it to dry. Looks good. Slept in this for 5 consecutive nights, and it kept me warm. Rolls up nicely into its little bag. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: rebizzy

customer_reviews.title: Are you big and tall plus in a 1 person tent? Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: The people that design these things must be small, skinny, or use a tent with a lot of room. Had to return. Texture feels nice.
customer_reviews.author: R. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: warm but sticky
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this because it would bind around me when i tried to turn over inside the mummy bag/ Im 170lbs and 5'9 so i thought it would fit me but i think it's more that the fabric wants to catch . I'm now looking for a "slippery" liner. I did notice that it added quite a bit of warmth though because when i removed it i could feel the cold coming up through my air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: fits great feels cozy
customer_reviews.text: this is just right. if you get chilly knees on that slipery s*** they put in these sleeping bags nowadays then you need this!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Hartsell

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and lightweight, but can be hard to get into
customer_reviews.text: Extremely lightweight and very comfortable, but a bit tough to get into in the dark, especially when it's inside your sleeping bag. Which kinda obviates the point of a sleeping bag *liner.*
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective heat supplement
customer_reviews.text: I do feel like this added at least 10 degrees to my comfort, combined with a full-down mummy bag, hammock, and 900-fill underquilt. It was 23 degrees outside - the water froze in the Camelbaks but I stayed toasty in bed!
customer_reviews.author: Kat S.

customer_reviews.title: good value. I use it every time I use ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps me from freezing! And if I don't need it its quick to pull out of my sleeping bag. good value. I use it every time I use my sleeping bag. Taking it to AK in two weeks. Don't travel w/o it.
customer_reviews.author: TODMTNS

customer_reviews.title: Pointy velcro :(
customer_reviews.text: Its not the lightest bag liner, and maybe not the most comfortable material, but it does its job. I had to remove the Velcro tabs. They're sharp, and dug into my face at night. Awful. But whatever, its a $20 bag liner. Good enough.
customer_reviews.author: b.rad

customer_reviews.title: This is great. it's light
customer_reviews.text: This is great. it's light, it's 1lb 5oz. during the summer, this is all I need and in colder months this inside my 20° bag sleeping in long johns, wasn't even cold, the temps were in the low 20s but it's soft, its plenty big for me, 33 at the shoulders by 80 long (inches) I'm 5' 10", weigh 180.
customer_reviews.author: BadlyBent

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to my 0 degree bag when I went cold weather camping in 3 degree snowy weather. Price was right and it helped add warmth to my mummy sleeping bag without having to buy a lower rated bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Tried this out only once so far but liked it! It fit my mummy bag nicely and ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried this out only once so far but liked it! It fit my mummy bag nicely and added a needed layer in 27 degree weather. Didn't constrict me moving around but would have appreciated if the bag was able to be opened down the side to make it easier to get in.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is poor, fabric is nice, designed for right zip.
customer_reviews.text: It really only works as a right zipper and my bag is a left. Additionally the toe box is smaller then my bag, I still would like one, but only if they had one that was compatible with my bag. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy R. Sievers

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. For backpacking it’s very small and light, adds that little bit of warmth that I’m always missing, and keeps my sleeping bag clean, wish I had gotten one when my bag was new. It’s really good for couch surfing too, puts a layer between you and the butt cushions haha.
customer_reviews.author: D-rock Ford

customer_reviews.title: This was a lot thinner than I had expected, ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a lot thinner than I had expected, but it worked perfectly for what I needed. It was really soft and kept me warm in my hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca F.

customer_reviews.title: Tight but works okay
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to but is very tight around your feet which makes it difficult to sleep sometimes especially if you have it in a mummy bag.
customer_reviews.author: BajaTime

customer_reviews.title: How much does a side zipper cost?
customer_reviews.text: This bag liner definitely extended my comfort about 10 degrees. It would definitely help if it had a side zipper!!!!! You have to crawl into this liner, then kick your way into your sleeping bag. Answering nature's call means you have to go through this whole process to get out and back in again. It is better than freezing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a hot and humid two night backpacking trip. After being wet for two days, the cooling wicking feeling of the liner was extremely comforting and contributed to good sleep. I still had my sleeping bag which I used as a quilt as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kids didn't feel it adding anything to the warmth of their sleeping bags while adding complexity to get in.
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a $20 sleeping bag liner
customer_reviews.text: Great for a $20 sleeping bag liner. I didn't want to spend 60 on a sea to summit brand. Only problem is it has a velcro close flap by your head, that if you are not completely in the liner, can sometimes rub against your skin.
customer_reviews.author: S Adams.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Item is as described, wish it would have had a zipper on the side though. It is the only Mommy style one I have found though for a liner of that size.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Needs a zipper...
customer_reviews.text: The liner is nice to have to keep the sleeping bag cleaner. It is easily washed making it nice to climb into a clean bag each outing. My only complaint is the lack of a zipper. The side opening does not extend far enough down the bag to allow for easy entry. You are essentially forced to slide into and out of the liner.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than anticipated, still effective for keeping your bag ...
customer_reviews.text: Lighter than anticipated, still effective for keeping your bag clean and body oil free, especially for down bag users. May have gone with a heavier liner as I was also looking for improved temp protection.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice liner
customer_reviews.text: This liner kept me warm, unfortunately i got the one facing the wrong side from my sleeping bag but it was still pretty good product.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nice texture
customer_reviews.text: I use inside a breathable SOL emergency bivy for warm summer backpacking, ~1lb together. A little narrow at the feet, but I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Get the job done for less. These are well put together and have survived a couple of multi-day camps without any wear. A liner keeps your bag from getting gross and keeps you warmer. A must have, I've bought another since the first purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sean O

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not having a zipper to open it up made is unusable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Leo Smrkovski

customer_reviews.title: The liner looks fine so I washed it and plan on using it ...
customer_reviews.text: It just arrived and the plastic packaging around the product was ripped as if someone opened it previously. The liner looks fine so I washed it and plan on using it next weekend. I will update this after.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor_C

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to sleep and packs down very small. I have used this on multiple hike and camping trips. Effortless to inflate. Could be a little narrow for a wider person.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A

customer_reviews.title: Used on EBC trek.....
customer_reviews.text: Used this on an Everest Base Camp trek inside my mummy bag and it DEFINITELY made a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Cost-Benefit Decision for Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: good addition to protect sleeping bag; comfortable; added marginal increase in warmth; decision whether you want to protect your bag or use the same weight to get extra warmth
customer_reviews.author: W Brey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, works. A bit rough.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, and will keep your bag clean. Obviously won't add much in terms of warmth, but for that, you'd need a more expensive/higher quality liner. Between this and the microfiber one of the same brand and almost the same price, I'd get the latter.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Doan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put in its sack
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put in its sack, nice cotton feeling for inside a larger sleeping bag. This is really comfortable to sleep inside if you're using it instead of a sleeping bag on warm nights as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Bouchelle

customer_reviews.title: does what I need it too, keeps my bag ...
customer_reviews.text: does what I need it too, keeps my bag a little more clean. Wish it could open a little further down for ease of getting into while hammock camping (may cut the side down another foot and add Velcro)
customer_reviews.author: Tory

customer_reviews.title: I think its great super convenient
customer_reviews.text: I think its great super convenient. I am not sure how much extra heat it adds on but so far so good. I will keep this updated if I dislike it . Slept great in it either way though !
customer_reviews.author: Brent Wong

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It helps me stay warmer and keep my bag cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Seelye

customer_reviews.title: This works great as an extra layer of warmth
customer_reviews.text: This works great as an extra layer of warmth, and protects your bag from body oils and dirt. Also, in warmer climates you can use it on top of your bag like a sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Troyer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every ounce of extra weight in your pack!
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing how much warmth this liner adds to my sleeping bag system. In addition to the warmth, it also keeps the sweat, dirt and oils from your body from getting directly to the sleeping bag. It is much easier to wash this liner after a few days of smelly use, than it is to wash your goose down sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: skisilly

customer_reviews.title: just right!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag liner for its intended purposes, A. Keep the bag clean and B. Add SOME warmth. Some people think a liner is going to get your sleeping bag down 15 degrees cooler, but that's just not the case. Most sleeping bag liners give you about 5-8 degrees more in the comfort rating. Alps is a great company shipping out economical gear. I wouldn't hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should add warmth, convenience to my sleep system.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this out in the woods yet, but I like the looks and feel of it. It will go far in helping to keep my bag clean on long-distance hikes, it feels as though it will add warmth to the bag on those chilly nights, and I like the ability to launder the liner rather than having to have my down bag cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lockney

customer_reviews.title: Good for my first liner
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy for UL backpacking, but the fabric is nice. I wish it opened down farther to allow for a leg to stick out when too warm.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keep me just a little warmer, and my sleeping bag a little cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great bag liner! Would be 5 stars if the closure was better, but I knew going in that I would need to replace it or reinforce it.
customer_reviews.author: NotAMorningPerson

customer_reviews.title: This made a great addition to our mummy bag - and really helped ...
customer_reviews.text: This made a great addition to our mummy bag - and really helped with the extra warmth on scout October camping - 40 degree night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Held up and protected my sleeping bag during ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Held up and protected my sleeping bag during a 12 day backpacking trip in Philmont.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy and light. Rolls right up with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy and light. Rolls right up with my Mummy Style sleeping bag and I don't even notice the extra weight or size.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle A. Galaz

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good price, fast shipping. Pretty narrow at the feet though. Wish it was wider
customer_reviews.author: S C

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used liner much as weather was warmer than expected but seems good and good value compared to very similar products available.
customer_reviews.author: Rick T

customer_reviews.title: Great liner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag liner... It is VERY roomy. I would purchase it again. Good value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: m max

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and feel, this is a wonderful material and Ilook forward to actually using it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two and one developed a tear from normal use but a good product.
customer_reviews.author: MikesRandomAdventures

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Son used it in Peru and he said it worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hot CA hunting
customer_reviews.text: I backpack during CA Azone dear season and due to the heat I skip the sleeping bag and use the liner to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: helps keep my down bag cleaner on the longer trips
customer_reviews.author: Allan Brainard

customer_reviews.title: Just an ok liner
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the liner was ok, for the money it was way to bulky to carry in addition to my other gear.
customer_reviews.author: Not Impressed

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a summer Alaska backpacking trip up in the Kenai Peninsula. For the price it worked really well. The summer was warmer than usual; ended up using just the liner instead of the sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Viet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 for the family, they kept our mummy bags clean on a 10 day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Challenged by this Mummy
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I expected, but this liner is not easy to get in and out of. Probably would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Hightest

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great feeling material. Can be used as a rolled up pillow when not needed for the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Manuela Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great product ..stitched well and add a lil warmth on the cooler nights ..
customer_reviews.author: Dman

customer_reviews.title: Product is good. The only issue I have is that the ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is good. The only issue I have is that the opening is on the opposite side of that on my sleeping bag
customer_reviews.author: mkaiser

customer_reviews.title: other wise it was a good
customer_reviews.text: Needs a zipper down the side, other wise it was a good buy
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gives a little extra wrarmth but kinda hard to manuver around in when in bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value mummy bag liner
customer_reviews.text: Works great. 4/5 because I was hoping it would be a little softer.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse B. Crandall

customer_reviews.title: nice. exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: nice. exactly as described. Fits very nicely in my mummy bag.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Works as it is stated. Have been using it every day for the past month and it hasnt broken or anything. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Turnipseed

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to try it out
customer_reviews.text: I fit snugly in the bag, only worry if it's strong enough... All the things I've read seem promising, I'll report back if it doesn't go well.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simple Liner to extend the life of your sleeping bag
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Negron

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ on a early spring trip in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: paul filla

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked great on my 10 day camping trip, kept the funk out of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: This will protect my sleeping bag and will be easy to pull out and wash
customer_reviews.text: ALPS Mountaineering MicroFiber Mummy Sleeping bag liner. Fits in my Kelty sleeping bag with a little room extra. Not too tight and not too loose. This will protect my sleeping bag and will be easy to pull out and wash. Packs well with the sleeping bag and I'm sure I'll use it by itself of those warm night. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my existing bags
customer_reviews.text: Thin light, soft, microfiber bag for sleeping bag liner. I use mine inside a German Army Sniper Sleeping bag and it provides an extra 10 degrees of warmth to extend the season just a little bit longer. Strongly suggest you eBay the German Army Sniper Sleeping Bag. If you get a good quality one you are set from the 30's to the 70s
customer_reviews.author: Ecliptic Plane

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to using this to keep the inside of the sleeping by clean.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Foshee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Found product to be of good quality and extremely useful. The product was everything as advertised
customer_reviews.author: MARCIA STINGER

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: It's a sheet sewn into a bag. Pretty simple. The Velcro closure ripped the first time I opened it. Sign of things to come? Maybe I oughta learn to sew!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like this liner mainly because is not made of exploited ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this liner mainly because is not made of exploited silk worms! The only weird thing is that the cord to "close" around the head is made of a material that got sticked to the Velcro next to it and is all ripped apart since the day 1... I don't close it so it doesn't bother me much, but that details should be considered.
customer_reviews.author: Greta Castro

customer_reviews.title: Good for skinny people.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but is hard to get into because the opening is too small.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but make sure you are not a wide-shoulder ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but make sure you are not a wide-shoulder man! I am 6'3 and it is plenty long, but when I get into it and pull it all the way up, it is very tight on my shoulders. Very nice in the summer to sleep in and I have used it once in cooler weather along with my normal sleeping bag, but usually have it pushed down to my under arms for comfort. Wide shoulders seems to be something that mummy bag manufactures underestimate as I have had 3 bags before I found one that fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley F.

customer_reviews.title: ... use it yet - but he thinks will be great for extra warm layer for outdoor winter camping
customer_reviews.text: Son hasn't had to use it yet - but he thinks will be great for extra warm layer for outdoor winter camping. Or it feels heavy enough as something to use by itself in more warmer weather camp outs.
customer_reviews.author: Kev31

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This worked great up backpacking to give me a little more warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Medsker

customer_reviews.title: outdoor must
customer_reviews.text: if you go camping much and use a sleeping bag this is something you have to have you pull it out and was it and the bad stays clean on the inside. just a little frebreze and put the bag away. if it is in the summertime use it by itself and sleep great.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Didn't seem to make much difference on the cold nights ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't seem to make much difference on the cold nights. Got wrapped up too tight with this inside of the mummy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Janice C. Bristol

customer_reviews.title: Find a different one
customer_reviews.text: Really delicate not made for hard use just look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Product FIne, but slightly heavier than advertised and significantly heavier than others
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag liner seems like a great quality product (with lifetime warranty) and has a soft feeling. However, it is heavier than advertised (13 oz + 2 for the sack), and is significantly heavier than others. So, it's not an ideal product if you're using it for backpacking or remote travel.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Quong

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: These do not come in solid grey but say Alps all over the cover. I was also expecting it to be cotton but it is more of a vinyl on the inside and it is slippery. Its not too easy to get in and out of. It does the job of keeping the sleeping bag clean by being a barrier but does not necessary keep you any warmer.
customer_reviews.author: digiproducer

customer_reviews.title: Not As Pictured
customer_reviews.text: The product its self seems fine, not super soft but it not as pictured the stuff sack is 9" and 14" in circumference The entire fabric has "alps" printed all over, which is not pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Mummy Sleeping Bag Liner
feature_bullets: Cozy sleeping bag liner for mummy style sleeping bags
Made of high quality Brushed Polyester fabric that will keep you warm all night
Conveniently includes a standard stuff sack for easy travel
If you're tired of trying to clean the inside of your sleeping bag and it's constantly getting dirty, a liner will be a great solution
